constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 200 (Wednesday, November 17, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. KUSTOFF:
H.R. 6004.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Under Article I, Section 8, the Necessary and Proper
Clause. Congress shall have power to make all laws which
shall be necessary and proper for carrying into Execution the
foregoing powers and all Powers vested by the Constitution in
the Government of the United States, or in Department of
Officer thereof.
[Page H6370]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Middle East, North Africa and Global Counterterrorism.

title: Upholding the 1995 Jerusalem Embassy Law Act of 2021
